content.description: The twice-differentiable functions f and g are defined for all real numbers x. Values of f, f', g, and g' for various values of x are given in the table above.
content.question: Explain why there must be a value c, for -1 < c < 1, such that f''(c)=0.

frqParts.text: Explain why there must be a value c, for -1 < c < 1, such that f''(c)=0.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
